meanings.definition: To form into a triangle shape.
meanings.sent1: She triangled the pieces of paper to make a hat.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter triangled the wooden blocks to build a sturdy frame.
meanings.sent3: The kids triangled their arms together to form a human chain.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully triangled the sushi pieces on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The artist triangled the colors on the canvas to create a beautiful pattern.

meanings.sent1: The triangled shape of the mountain peak was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The ancient pyramid had a triangled base that stood the test of time.
meanings.sent3: The oddly triangled rock formation looked like a giant arrowhead.
meanings.sent4: Her face lit up with a triangled smile when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The triangled pattern on the rug added a touch of elegance to the room.
